intro: Wagenitzia, commonly known as the desert broom, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and compound leaves. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through deep root systems and reduced leaf surfaces. Wagenitzia is often found in rocky soils and can thrive with minimal water. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and nectar for pollinators in its native range.
